data.title: Okay.....
data.text: Granted, the selection of martini bars are slim to none in SLC, having said that Kristauf's is okay.  The ambience is okay but not an SLC take home location.  The martini's are okay but not what I would expect for an establishment that bills themselves as a martini bar.  Would I go there again?  Sure .... the pickings are slim in downtown SLC,

data.title: Great historical bldg.
data.text: we loved the bldg. so had to stop in for a drink while walking a block or so off Main St., nice local bar

data.title: good selection of drinks
data.text: We stopped by for a drink while we waited on our table at Takashi. Lots of great options. I had a Moscow Mule. It was good. Staff was friendly. Atmosphere was also good. We would definitely consider going back for a post dinner drink.

data.title: Great location and martinis
data.text: I often stop by for a martini here while waiting for a table at Takashi.  It makes the long wait go by quickly. The staff is wonderful and very prompt.

data.title: Very good drinks and service
data.text: They have a very good selection of martinis and very good service to go along with it. Would recommend highly.

data.title: Martini Bar for Evening Fun
data.text: We went to the Martini Bar for dessert martini's. Warm, friendly atmosphere.  Wonderful martini's!  Live music.

data.title: Love the cocktails
data.text: The cocktails are just incredible. Such a fun and lovely bar! And once you are done with drinks, head over to Takashi next door for some mind blowing sushi!

data.title: I dont even drink Martini's!
data.text:
We were in town for a wedding (guess what kind) and after the event on the first night we:
1.  Lost our buzz
2.  Annoyed we only had an hour and a half to hit up a bar 
3.  Desperate to get our buzz back

So, I did my research and Kristauf's Martini Bar was the place we headed to.  First off, the décor was really cool.  Nice warm ambience, not too crowded, and the layout was just right.  Not too open with unnecessary space.  Dance floor was a good size.  The people were so chill.  The place didn't feel pretentious at all.  Then there was the music...perfect!  Mostly top 40 with a little mix here and there.  We got to the bar and Wes the bartender was professional and hella helped with everything, especially with picking a drink.  I don't drink Martini's often and I really just wanted something strong and not fruity.  Wes HOOKED IT UP!!!  Whatever he made, got my cousin and sister dancing after like 2 sips LMAO.  Anyway, he was hella chill, totally made our night!  If you go there, ask for Wes.  Im sure the other bartenders are cool, but not as cool as Wes haha.  Its a shame we couldn't return the next night.  If Im ever in SLC, Im hitting this place up again.

data.title: Still agreat bar
data.text: Love it. Always here before we got to Takashi. I like the drinks and they make great martinis and have an excellent wine selection.

data.title: BEST MARTINIS EVER!!
data.text:
We had some time to kill, waiting for our table at the Market Street Grill, and decided to go for a beer at this bar. Well, as soon as we got the menu for drinks, we ended up trying out several martinis instead.. the bartender was super lovely and skilled, and entertained us while mixing the drinks and helping the other customers as well! 
After dinner, we went back to this place and we absolutely loved it! Not loads of people on a Tuesday evening in SLC, but with our group of 6, we still enjoyed it. And the drinks are by far the best we had on our trip in the States.

data.title: We alays have cocktails here before takashi
data.text: This is a quiet comfortable place to conduct business prior to the noisy hustle and bustle of takashi ...which is perfect when entertaining clients from Europe.  They have great mojitos even though they are known for martini's.  I like the fact that the managers treat you equally whether you are there for Takashi or not.  Just wish there was a way to carry our drink next door when our table is ready.

data.title: While you wait for a table at Takashi,
data.text: you may as well belly up.  Neither the menu nor the service are terribly enlightened, but the selection is wide, prices are reasonable and the atmosphere tolerable.

data.title: A fun place to grab a drink before going our dancing or waiting for sushi at Takashis... plus a great friend works...
data.text: A fun place to grab a drink before going our dancing or waiting for sushi at Takashis... plus a great friend works there.
